searchDocs.title: Fire​
searchDocs.content: </> Client:Fire( event: string,-- Event name ...: any-- Arguments to send ) → () Fires an event to the server (batched). Event will be sent on the next Heartbeat.

searchDocs.title: FireNow​
searchDocs.content: </> Client:FireNow( event: string,-- Event name ...: any-- Arguments to send ) → () Fires an event to the server immediately (unbatched). Event is sent instantly without waiting for Heartbeat.

searchDocs.title: Call​
searchDocs.content: </> Client:Call( event: string,-- Event name ...: any-- Arguments to send ) → Promise<...any> Calls a server function and returns a Promise with the result.

searchDocs.title: On​
searchDocs.content: </> Client:On( events: {[string]: (...any) → ()} | string,-- Event name or table of events callback: ((...any) → ())?-- Callback function (if events is a string) ) → () Registers event listener(s) for incoming server events.

searchDocs.title: Server​
searchDocs.content: </> NetLink.Server( name: string,-- Namespace identifier unreliable: boolean?-- Whether to use UnreliableRemoteEvent (default: false) ) → Server Creates or retrieves a server namespace.

searchDocs.title: Client​
searchDocs.content: </> NetLink.Client( name: string,-- Namespace identifier unreliable: boolean?-- Whether to use UnreliableRemoteEvent (default: false) ) → Client Creates or retrieves a client namespace.

searchDocs.title: Fire​
searchDocs.content: </> Server:Fire( player: Player ,-- Target player event: string,-- Event name ...: any-- Arguments to send ) → () Fires an event to a specific player (batched). Event will be sent on the next Heartbeat.

searchDocs.title: FireNow​
searchDocs.content: </> Server:FireNow( player: Player ,-- Target player event: string,-- Event name ...: any-- Arguments to send ) → () Fires an event to a specific player immediately (unbatched). Event is sent instantly without waiting for Heartbeat.

searchDocs.title: FireAll​
searchDocs.content: </> Server:FireAll( event: string,-- Event name ...: any-- Arguments to send ) → () Fires an event to all connected players (batched).

searchDocs.title: FireAllExcept​
searchDocs.content: </> Server:FireAllExcept( except: Player ,-- Player to exclude event: string,-- Event name ...: any-- Arguments to send ) → () Fires an event to all players except one (batched).

searchDocs.title: FireList​
searchDocs.content: </> Server:FireList( playerList: {Player },-- Array of target players event: string,-- Event name ...: any-- Arguments to send ) → () Fires an event to a specific list of players (batched).

searchDocs.title: FireWithFilter​
searchDocs.content: </> Server:FireWithFilter( filter: (player: Player ) → boolean,-- Filter function event: string,-- Event name ...: any-- Arguments to send ) → () Fires an event to players matching a filter function (batched).

searchDocs.title: On​
searchDocs.content: </> Server:On( events: {[string]: ( player: Player , ...any ) → ()} | string,-- Event name or table of events callback: (( player: Player , ...any ) → ())?-- Callback function (if events is a string) ) → () Registers event listener(s) for incoming client events.

searchDocs.title: WithRateLimit​
searchDocs.content: </> Server:WithRateLimit( config: RateLimitConfig | "strict" | "normal" | "relaxed" | "burst"-- Rate limit configuration or preset ) → Server-- Returns self for chaining Enables rate limiting for this namespace. Example: local Combat = NetLink.Server("Combat") :WithRateLimit("strict") :WithRateLimit({ MaxCalls = 5, TimeWindow = 1, Strategy = "sliding", OnExceeded = function(key, attempts) local player = Players:GetPlayerByUserId(tonumber(key)) if player and attempts > 20 then player:Kick("Rate limit abuse") end end })

searchDocs.title: GetRateLimiter​
searchDocs.content: </> Server:GetRateLimiter() → RateLimit? Gets the rate limiter for this namespace (if enabled). Example: local limiter = Combat:GetRateLimiter() if limiter then local stats = limiter:GetStats() print(`Block rate: {stats.BlockRate * 100}%`) end

searchDocs.title: ResetRateLimit​
searchDocs.content: </> Server:ResetRateLimit(player: Player ) → () Resets rate limit data for a specific player. Example: Combat:ResetRateLimit(player)

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> RateLimit.new( config: RateLimitConfig-- Configuration options ) → RateLimit Creates a new RateLimit instance. Example: local limiter = RateLimit.new({ MaxCalls = 10, TimeWindow = 1, Strategy = "sliding", OnExceeded = function(key, attempts) warn(`Player {key} exceeded rate limit ({attempts} attempts)`) end })

searchDocs.title: Preset​
searchDocs.content: </> RateLimit.Preset(preset: "strict" | "normal" | "relaxed" | "burst") → RateLimitConfig Creates a preset configuration for common use cases. Example: local strictLimiter = RateLimit.new(RateLimit.Preset("strict")) local relaxedLimiter = RateLimit.new(RateLimit.Preset("relaxed"))

searchDocs.title: Check​
searchDocs.content: </> RateLimit:Check( key: string-- Unique identifier (usually player.UserId) ) → ( boolean,-- Whether the action is allowed number?-- Time until next available slot (if blocked) ) Checks if a key can perform an action based on rate limits. Example: local allowed, retryAfter = limiter:Check(tostring(player.UserId)) if not allowed then player:Kick(`Rate limit exceeded. Retry after {retryAfter} seconds`) end

searchDocs.title: Reset​
searchDocs.content: </> RateLimit:Reset( key: string-- Key to reset ) → () Resets rate limit data for a specific key. Example: limiter:Reset(tostring(player.UserId))

searchDocs.title: ResetAll​
searchDocs.content: </> RateLimit:ResetAll() → () Resets all rate limit data. Example: limiter:ResetAll()

searchDocs.title: GetRemaining​
searchDocs.content: </> RateLimit:GetRemaining(key: string) → number-- Remaining calls available Gets the current number of remaining calls for a key. Example: local remaining = limiter:GetRemaining(tostring(player.UserId)) print(`You have {remaining} requests remaining`)

searchDocs.title: GetStats​
searchDocs.content: </> RateLimit:GetStats() → RateLimitStats Gets comprehensive statistics about rate limiting. Example: local stats = limiter:GetStats() print(`Block rate: {stats.BlockRate * 100}%`) print("Most blocked players:") for _, entry in stats.MostBlockedKeys do print(` {entry.Key}: {entry.Count} blocks`) end

searchDocs.title: AddTokens​
searchDocs.content: </> RateLimit:AddTokens( key: string, amount: number ) → () Adds tokens to a token bucket (for token bucket strategy only). Useful for granting extra capacity to VIP players. Example: -- Give VIP player extra tokens if player:GetAttribute("IsVIP") then limiter:AddTokens(tostring(player.UserId), 10) end

searchDocs.title: SetMaxCalls​
searchDocs.content: </> RateLimit:SetMaxCalls(newMax: number) → () Adjusts the maximum calls limit dynamically. Example: -- Increase limit during off-peak hours if hour >= 2 and hour <= 6 then limiter:SetMaxCalls(20) else limiter:SetMaxCalls(10) end
